page.title: 16Housing
page.content: The large houses are mainly farmhouses and many smaller houses were originally farm cottages. Many are old sixteenth century onward, 20 houses in the area are listed, 21 have been built since the war. The houses are mainly stone, with some timber framing, very little brick. The school has been turned into council houses. Except for the houses inhabited by farm workers and the council houses, most houses are owner occpied. Some old houses have been modernised with the help of government grants. Until recently planning authorities refused permission for new houses in the country claiming that the inhabitants of such houses made abnormal demands on social services. Now there seems to be a change. A redundant farm complex is being converted into five houses and two bungalows are to be built.
